main event: A large brilliant blue-white flaming object was observed in Thermopolis, Wyoming on October 10, 1957, which turned out to be related to the launch of a satellite, later identified as a meteor.
interesting points: The sighting lasted between 1 to 45 seconds.,Multiple military and civilian witnesses were present.,The object appeared to have several smaller components with a blue-flamed tail.,The incident caused significant public excitement and was reported on television and radio.,The investigation concluded that the object was a disintegrating meteor and not an aerial vehicle.
